bug.author: yanniszark
bug.summary: kfctl: existing_arrikto: LoadBalancer address discovery doesn't work for AWS
bug.description: In platform existing_arrikto, we get the LoadBalancer address by looking at status.loadBalancer.ingresses[0].ip. However, ELB gives a hostname, not an IP. The logic should be fixed to also work for hostname. /priority p0 /assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> Can you provide an update please? We will likely cut v0.6.2 this week. If you'd like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3760>#3760</denchmark-link> to be included can you get that PR merged and then cherry-pick it onto the v0.6-branch?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> it seems <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> has LGTM'd it but the CI bot hasn't picked it up. However, the v2.zip file no longer exists in master, but will exist in v0.6.2. In order to deal with this I understand that I need 2 PRs:
Merge this functionality in master, without the changes to v2.zip. Cherry pick it in v0.6.2, adding the changes to v2.zip.
I will use <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3760>#3760</denchmark-link> to merge in master and open another PR to cherry pick the change in v0.6-branch. Does this sound good ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> Sounds good. How does release work? 0.6.2 will be cut based on 0.6-branch or a separate branch. If it's 0.6-branch, I think there's no need to cherry-pick to v0.6.2

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> v0.6.2 will be cut based on the v0.6-branch. PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3760>#3760</denchmark-link> adds the functionality to master. From there, it will be cherry picked to the v0.6-branch. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> if you are ok with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3760>#3760</denchmark-link> , can you please LGTM it?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> it looks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3760>#3760</denchmark-link> was merged. Has it been cherry-picked to v0.6-branch? If not can one of you open a cherry pick please? These instructions explain how to use our helper script to create cherry-picks. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/hack/cherry-picks.md>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/hack/cherry-picks.md</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> the commit that cherry picks this in v0.6-branch is this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/2c9dfe5edd68d026f6fa137a3533a2ab4d9021f1>2c9dfe5</denchmark-link>
While it was cherry picked before the PR was merged, in essence nothing changed, only the v2.zip file was removed.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> Thanks so can we close this issue? If not what work remains to close this out?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> So is this issue resolved? Can we close it?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
/close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> This change was merged to master and v0.6.1. I just close the issue
